lyrics.translation: 第61课，哈勃望远镜的问题。

lyrics.text: First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: What is the special importance of a telescope in space?
lyrics.translation: 望远镜在太空中的特殊重要性是什么？

lyrics.text: The Hubble telescope was launched into space by NASA on April 20, 1990, at a cost of over a billion dollars.
lyrics.translation: 哈勃望远镜于1990年4月20日由美国宇航局发射升空，耗资超过十亿美元。

lyrics.text: Right from the start there was trouble with the Hubble.
lyrics.translation: 从一开始，哈勃望远镜就遇到了麻烦。

lyrics.text: The pictures it sent us were very disappointing because its main mirror was faulty.
lyrics.translation: 它发送给我们的图片非常令人失望，因为它的主镜有故障。

lyrics.text: NASA is now going to put the telescope right, so it will soon be sending up four astronauts to repair it.
lyrics.translation: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）现在要修复望远镜，所以很快将有四名宇航员被派去修复它。

lyrics.text: The shuttle Endeavour will be taking the astronauts to the Hubble.
lyrics.translation: 航天飞机“奋进号”将把宇航员带到哈勃望远镜那里。

lyrics.text: A robot arm from the Endeavour will grab the telescope and hold it while the astronauts make the necessary repairs.
lyrics.translation: “奋进号”上的一个机械臂将抓住望远镜并将其固定，同时宇航员进行必要的修复。

lyrics.text: Of course, the Hubble is above the Earth's atmosphere, so it will soon be sending us the clearest pictures of the stars and distant galaxies that we have ever seen.
lyrics.translation: 当然，哈勃望远镜位于地球大气层之上，因此它很快将向我们发送我们所见过的最清晰的恒星和遥远星系的图片。

lyrics.text: The Hubble will tell us a great deal about the age and size of the universe.
lyrics.translation: 哈勃望远镜将告诉我们关于宇宙的年龄和大小的许多信息。

lyrics.text: By the time you read this, the Hubble's eagle eye will have sent us thousands and thousands of wonderful pictures.
lyrics.translation: 到你读到这篇文章的时候，哈勃望远镜的鹰眼已经为我们发送了成千上万张精彩的照片。
